name: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming in Python
description: Introduction to computer science and programming for students with little or no programming experience. Students develop skills to program and use computational techniques to solve problems.

name: Mathematics for Computer Science
description: Introduction to discrete mathematics, including logic, set theory, combinatorics, graph theory, and algorithms.

name: Introduction to Algorithms
description: Introduction to algorithms for students with at least a little programming experience. Topics include sorting, searching, dynamic programming, greedy algorithms, and graph algorithms.

name: Introduction to EECS I
description: Introduction to electrical engineering and computer science for students with no prior programming experience. Topics include digital logic, computer architecture, and programming in Python.

name: Introduction to EECS II
description: Continuation of 6.01. Topics include circuits, signals and systems, and programming in C.

name: Signals and Systems
description: Introduction to signals and systems, including Fourier series and transforms, Laplace transforms, and discrete-time signals and systems.

name: Computation Structures
description: Introduction to digital systems and computer architecture. Topics include combinational and sequential logic, computer organization, and memory systems.

name: Elements of Software Construction
description: Introduction to software engineering and programming methodology. Topics include testing, debugging, and software design.

name: Computer System Engineering
description: Introduction to computer systems engineering, including operating systems, networks, and distributed systems.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: Introduction to artificial intelligence, including search algorithms, game playing, and machine learning.
